SENT.plain: An 81-year-old man, with a history of pulmonary tuberculosis presented with coma after coughing associated to haemoptysis
The CT-scan revealed several scattered gas bubbles, while the thoracic scan disclosed an old tubercular parenchymatous cave
In spite of several sessions of hyperbaric oxygen treatment, the patient died with multivisceral organ failure
This case report reviews the pathophysiology of gas embolism due to coughing
